title: Define Project Requirements - Revised
description: Gather and document the comprehensive requirements for the AIArchitect system. The requirements should include input formats (structured data, programming languages, supporting files), desired outputs (architecture designs, performance metrics, scalability metrics, maintainability scores, interactive visualizations), any specific constraints or considerations (security standards, platform compatibility, performance benchmarks, usability guidelines, accessibility standards), non-functional requirements (response times, memory usage, error handling mechanisms, logging and monitoring), expected interaction between the AI system and human designers (feedback and suggestions for improvement during the design process, mechanism for designers to override or customize AI system's suggestions), handling edge cases, potential errors, and a mechanism for designers to provide feedback. Additionally, the documentation should be organized in a user-friendly format, easily accessible, regularly updated as new requirements arise, and clearly categorized based on the nature of the requirement (e.g., functional, non-functional, technical debt). It should also include any necessary API documentation if applicable, with clear examples and usage scenarios. The documentation will serve as a guide for developers during the implementation phase and should be reviewed by both the project manager and code architect before implementation to ensure they align with the project vision and goals. Once completed, the document will undergo further review from the assigned team member (task-decomposer) for initial comments or suggested edits before moving forward. To streamline the review process, please provide initial comments or suggested edits within this RFC task before it is assigned for final review. The rfc_state field should be updated to 'READY_FOR_TEAM_REVIEW'.

title: Design System Architecture (Approved and Ready for Task Decomposition)
description: Designed the overall architecture of the AIArchitect system, including components, data flow, interactions between different modules, and considerations for scalability, maintainability, performance, security, fault tolerance, and extensibility. The design has been reviewed and approved by the team. It is recommended to update the RFC document with detailed specifications for each module (including their functionalities, APIs, data structures, and expected performance metrics), interfaces, and expected interactions between different modules, along with potential bottlenecks and solutions to mitigate them. Please ensure that the updated document clearly defines the roles and responsibilities of each module and includes an estimation of resources required for implementation.

title: Develop AI Model
description: Implement the core AI model responsible for generating and evaluating software architecture designs based on project requirements.

title: Build User Interface
description: Develop the user interface for interacting with the AIArchitect system, including input forms, visualization tools, and result displays.

title: Implement Data Storage
description: Set up the database and storage systems for storing project requirements, generated architecture designs, and any other necessary data.

title: Establish Deployment and Monitoring
description: Configure the deployment environment, continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines, and monitoring systems for the AIArchitect system.

title: Conduct Security Audits
description: Perform security audits and implement necessary security measures to ensure the AIArchitect system is secure and compliant with relevant regulations.

title: Create Documentation
description: Develop comprehensive documentation for the AIArchitect system, including user guides, technical documentation, and maintenance manuals.

title: Test and Validate
description: Perform thorough testing and validation of the AIArchitect system, including unit tests, integration tests, and user acceptance testing.
